benchmark_details.name: Multilingual Collaborative Defense (MCD)
benchmark_details.overview: MCD is a novel learning method that optimizes a continuous soft safety prompt to facilitate multilingual safeguarding of Large Language Models (LLMs) against harmful queries, enhancing robustness across diverse languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the robustness and security of Large Language Models (LLMs) against multilingual jailbreak queries.

data.source: Translated datasets based on previous research including MaliciousInstruct and AdvBench, extending to multilingual versions.
data.size: 3,150 samples (including 315 in English and parallel samples in multiple languages)

methodology.calculation: Comparative analysis against baseline methods using statistical tests.
methodology.interpretation: Lower ASR indicates better defense performance against harmful queries.
methodology.baseline_results: Demonstrated significant improvement over existing defenses in multilingual settings.
methodology.validation: Statistical significance tests (p-values) were performed to confirm the robustness of results.
